SEARCH
Package io.lyuda.jcards

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
io.lyuda.jcards.Deck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Deck>
public class Deck extends Object implements Comparable<Deck>
The Deck class represents a deck of cards. It is used to create and manage a collection of cards.

A deck of cards is created with all the possible combinations of suits and ranks, and can be shuffled and dealt from. The deck keeps track of the number of cards remaining and throws an exception if an attempt is made to deal from an empty deck.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
lyudaio

    • deal

      public List<Card> deal(int amount)
      Deals a specified amount of cards from the deck.
      Parameters:
      amount - the number of cards to be dealt
      Returns:
      a list of dealt cards
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the deck is empty or if the amount of cards to be dealt is greater than the number of cards in the deck

    • deal

      public Card deal()
      Deals the next card from the deck.
      Returns:
      the next card in the deck
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the deck is empty

    • findCard

      public int findCard(Rank rank, Suit suit)
      Searches the deck for a specific card based on its rank and suit.
      Parameters:
      rank - the rank of the card to search for
      suit - the suit of the card to search for
      Returns:
      the index of the card in the deck, 0 if empty, or -1 if the card is not found

    • findCardsByRank

      public List<Integer> findCardsByRank(Rank rank)
      Searches the deck for a specific rank.
      Parameters:
      rank - the rank to search for
      Returns:
      a list of the indices of the cards in the deck with the specified rank

    • getCardAtIndex

      public Card getCardAtIndex(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Gets the card at the specified index in the deck.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the desired card
      Returns:
      the card at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index (less than) 0 || index >= deck size)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Deck o)
      Compares two deck of cards based on their size.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Deck>
      Parameters:
      o - the deck to compare to
      Returns:
      a negative integer if this deck has less cards than `o`, zero if this deck has the same number of cards as `o`, or a positive integer if this deck has more cards than `o`.

    • getCards

      public List<Card> getCards()
      Retrieves the most up-to-date list of cards stored in the object.
      Returns:
      A list of Card objects stored in the object, which reflects any changes made to the underlying list.

      The returned list may be empty, but it will never be null.

      Since:
      0.0.3
      See Also:
      • Card
